availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edwin Vincent (1st lieutenant, 5th Kentucky Cavalry (Co. D))

body.p: A Kentucky farmer, merchant, and soldier. Married to Julia Ann B. Carver Vincent. Father of Margaret E. Vincent and Landers M. Vincent. Member of the Republican Party. Served as a first lieutenant in the 5th Kentucky Cavalry (Co. D) from March 31, 1862 to May 15, 1864.

bibl.p: Edwin Vincent, 5th Kentucky Cavalry, Compiled Service Record, (https://www.fold3.com/image/221415983) (accessed on May 8, 2017); Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 118-119; W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the States (Louisville: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 859-860; "Edwin Vincent," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=124814396&ref=acom) (accessed on may 8, 2017); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District No. 1, p. 31; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Carver Precinct, p. 14.
